glosses: Wallachia (a historical region and former principality in Eastern Europe, now part of southern Romania)
Wallachia, Moravian Wallachia (a cultural region in northeast Moravia, in the Czech Republic; in full, Moravian Wallachia)

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish افلاق (eflak, “Wallachia”), from Old Church Slavonic влахъ m (vlaxŭ, “a Roman; a Vlach”), from Proto-Slavic *vòlxъ m (“a Roman”) ultimately from Proto-Germanic *walhaz m (“a non-Germanic foreigner, aCelt; later a Roman”).
